channel.title: Apartment Therapy | Saving the world, one room at a time
channel.description: Saving the world, one room at a time

item.title: 3 Tech Tips For New Renters — Renters Solutions
item.description:
If you're renting a home or an apartment, you'll be well served to check out our huge roundup of the best tips for renters. But once you've moved in, there's always a few upgrades and customizations that can turn a rental into "your home"...even if it's not really yours. Here are a few tips for utilizing add-on technologies which will extend the comfort of your home while still honoring your rental agreement...

More
item.author: Jason Yang

item.title: Loaf — Store Profile
item.description:
With a focus on squishy, slouchy and comfortable furniture, Loaf is the absolute perfect name for this UK retailer. The store originally launched as a bed specialist in 2008 and since then has expanded to include casual furniture for the entire home. 
More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Party Appetizer Recipe: Cheddar Olives
item.description:
With these cheddar olives, my favorite straight-from-freezer-to-oven recipe, there are never any leftovers. Ever. No matter how many I make. 

• Cheddar Olives
  The Kitchn
item.author: Cambria Bold

item.title: Is Seventies Sofa Set Worth Reupholstering? — Good Questions
item.description:
Q: I have a sofa/chair/ottoman set, purchased in the 70s.  It is nothing special or sentimental.
1.  Is it worth reupholstering?
2.  Should I consider trying to do it myself (no experience)?
3.  Can I get some kind of estimate for a professional job?  A "WAG" would be just fine to give me an idea. Thanks.

More
item.author: Regina Yunghans

item.title: 10 Meditations for Spring
item.description:
Every week I look forward to Dana Velden's Weekend Meditation here at The Kitchn. Her small essays always prompt me towards thoughtfulness and gratitude, and peel back new layers of thinking about the kitchen, the home, and living in the world. 

• 10 Meditations for Spring
  The Kitchn
item.author: Cambria Bold

item.title: 9 Outdoor Rugs You'll Want to Use Inside
item.description:
You may find the outdoor rugs in this roundup so attractive that you'll be tempted to use them indoors. So go ahead and do it! Outdoor rugs are great in the kitchen, bath, entryway or any other space that sees a lot of traffic and potential wet messes.
More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Sirima's Vintage Industrial Artist's Loft — House Tour
item.description:
Name: Sirima Sataman
Location: Dogpatch, San Francisco, California
Size: 800 square feet
Years lived in: 2 years; Rented

Walking into Sirima's loft, I was blown away by the openness of the space, despite the fact that it is both her home and an artist's studio where she teaches classes and workshops in printmaking. A combination of smart, vertical storage (keep an eye out for a kayak, two surfboards and two bikes) and a collection of great vintage pieces makes everything flow together seamlessly.

More
item.author: Kim Lucian

item.title: Seth & Allison's Kitchen: The Home Stretch — Renovation Diary
item.description:
Name: Seth & Allison 
Type of Project: Kitchen/Family Room renovation 
Location: Ventura, California 
Type of building: Mid-Century, multi-level, single family home

The Renovation Diaries are a new collaboration with our community in which we feature your step by step renovation progress and provide monetary support towards getting it done in style. See all of our Reno Diaries here.

We finally have a kitchen! And since we’ve been simultaneously renovating the entire house along with this kitchen/family room project, we’re breathing a big sigh of relief that the house is ready to live in at last!

More
item.author: Guest

item.title: Shop the Room: Anne & Steve's Modern Pastel Living Room
item.description:
I love the look of this light and airy living room. From the high back sofa — perfect for being set up in the middle of the room — to the colorful rug, each piece works together to create a simple but beautiful room. I've rounded up a few of the key elements in the room so the look can be recreated in our own homes.

More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Pros & Cons of Raising Backyard Chickens
item.description:
I'm not sure about where you live, but in Seattle and the rest of the Pacific Northwest, raising chickens is about as prevalent as having any other kind of domesticated animals. It's not uncommon to see city suburb coops in neighbors' backyards or to be gifted fresh eggs from a friend's chickens.

More
item.author: Andie Powers

item.title: Design Quiz: Test Your Architecture IQ
item.description:
Think you know a balustrade from a newel? Or a louver from a flue? What characterizes colonial-style architecture, and how did painted ladies get their name? Just for fun, take this quick quiz to see just how architecturally savvy you are. 

More
item.author: Carolyn Purnell

item.title: The #1 Reason for Hanging Out, Out Front
item.description:
We used to have this one family on our apartment block, who, in all kinds of weather, you would find playing out front: mom, dad, and their two daughters. Not out back of our building, where there are trees and grass and picnic tables, but out front, where there is an ugly parking lot and a shriveled, sad attempt at a garden. Why were they out there? What was with that?

More
item.author: Alison Gerber

item.title: Getting Organized: Paperwork to Shred, Scan, or Store Infographic — Women & Co
item.description:
As hard as I try, I always end up with at least a few folders full of receipts, forms, and miscellaneous items throughout the year, inevitably cluttering my filing cabinet and desk drawer. Since the tax deadline has come and gone, it's an opportune time to empty out the drawers full of "I'll get to that later" papers and decide what to shred, what to scan and store on a flash drive, and which items to retain on file.

More
item.author: Gregory Han

item.title: Sarah & Fred's Leafy Art-House — House Tour
item.description:
Name: Sarah Schmitz and Fred Gray
 Location: Berkeley, California
Size: 1,200 square feet
Years lived in: 2 years; Owned

Plants make a house feel fresh. Just take a look at Sarah and Fred's leafy Berkeley abode. The beautiful one-bedroom house came with the Christmasy poinsettia out front, but the rows of potted succulents and happy houseplants are the result of Sarah's own green thumb.

More
item.author: Celeste Sunderland

item.title: Digitally Inspired Design: The 8-Bit Look
item.description:
The inner nerd inside of me never tires of novelty items inspired by digital and technology. Everyday objects applied with a bit of geeky design are great conversation starters and appreciated by others in the industry. Here are a few of my favorite digitally-inspired designs. 


More
item.author: Julienne Lin

item.title: A Bit Of Control In Times Of Chaos: Organizing The Closet
item.description:
When the world (or at least our little corner of it) seems too overwhelming and chaotic, it's tempting to exert some control. That control can take different forms for each person, ranging from healthy conflict management to dangerous eating disorders, with a bit of bossiness thrown in for good measure. In an effort to stay on the healthy, pleasant-to-be-around end of the spectrum, I tackled the closet...

More
item.author: Tess Wilson

item.title: A Bit Of Control: Organizing The Closet
item.description:
When the world (or at least our little corner of it) seems too overwhelming and chaotic, it's tempting to exert some control. That control can take different forms for each person, ranging from healthy conflict management to dangerous eating disorders, with a bit of bossiness thrown in for good measure. In an effort to stay on the healthy, pleasant-to-be-around end of the spectrum, I tackled the closet...

item.author: Tess Wilson

item.title: Messages of Hope for Boston Light Up Brooklyn Academy of Music — Design News 04.16.13
item.description:
The Illuminator, a van outfitted with projection technology, was in Brooklyn last night displaying solidarity with Boston. The van was originally set to protest on Wall Street for Tax Day, but quickly regrouped in light of the explosions during the Marathon. One projection was the Martin Luther King quotation, "Darkness cannot drive out darkness, only light can do that." 

In other news, social media is playing a role in terror investigations. See the headlines after the jump.

More
item.author: Tara Bellucci

item.title: Outdoor Inspiration: Dining Al Fresco
item.description:
I have the tiniest balcony that barely fits a café table and chairs for dining a deux. It currently needs a reprieve from the IKEA chairs that have seen a few too many seasons, and I hope to refresh it over the next month and post the before and after. In my quest to update my balcony, I've been doing a little research — take a look at some inspiring spaces that I found for al fresco dining.

More
item.author: Claire Bock

item.title: Bring in Spring: Greenify the Space Under Your Sink
item.description:
If you're tired of looking at that ugly pipe under your sink, here's a quick tip for hiding that plumbing, adding some life to your bathroom, and improving the air quality inside — all at the same time!

More
item.author: Linda Ly

item.title: One Design, Two Budgets: Modern Nursery
item.description:
Whoever gets this nursery is one cool customer, rockin' night time with black and white decor and bright pops of primary color. This design comes in at $2,991. Click below to see resources, along with a much less expensive version.

More
item.author: Dabney Frake

item.title: Simple as Black & White: Striped Outdoor Decor
item.description:
Black and white stripes pack a bold punch, which is great, because summer is no time to be subdued and demure. Go for it with this striped furniture and decor for the outdoors.

More
item.author: Dabney Frake

item.title: DIY Idea: Faux Marble Table Top — Poppytalk
item.description:
When Jan at design blog Poppytalk realized her DOCKSTA table from IKEA was in need of a makeover, she came up with this surprisingly simple hack to cover up the stains, scuffs and dings on the surface of the table. Can you guess what she did?

More
item.author: Linda Ly

item.title: Prominent Planters: Rustic, Modern & Upcycled Pots — The Tuesday Scavenger
item.description:
These are some honkin' planters, ready to be up front and center in your yard or patio.
  • Austin, TX: Rustic Metal Planter - $295
  • Dallas, TX: Zinc Outdoor Planter - $125
  • Brooklyn, NY: Tin Tub - $165
  • Los Angeles, CA: Square Planters - $110
  • Austin, TX: Upcycled Metal Planter - $295
More
item.author: Dabney Frake

item.title: A Montessori/Waldorf-Inspired School at Home for Bea & Friends
item.description:
Our home is our first classroom, but in Bea's case, her home really is her classroom. Her mother, Nichole, homeschools her and runs a small, part-time home-based preschool. This classroom is inspiring whether you are planning a space for formal learning or just looking for ways to create an environment at home to inspire and edify your child.  

More
item.author: Carrie McBride
